intro: Berkheyopsis rehmannii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water, while its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red. Berkheyopsis rehmannii is often found in disturbed areas and can spread readily through its seeds.
